body:
Add an option to the `spack external find` command that displays the currently-configured external packages

### Rationale

Currently the only way to list external packages via Spack is to execute `spack config get packages`. The only other method appears to be to manually parse the `packages.yaml` file, which can be prone to typically human errors.

### Description

Since the `external` command already has an internal function `_get_predefined_externals()` that gathers the specs for currently-configured external packages, it should be simple to create an option that calls `spack.cmd.display_specs(...)` with the predefined externals list. I recommend the command `spack external find --in-config` that would list the already-configured externals.


### Additional information
No additional information


### General information

- [X] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
  - 0.16.2-2884-b375500
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: external find: show list of already-configured external packages
